function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate sanitation and wastewater management in residential buildings, leading to the potential spread of viruses through sewage."},{"name":"Inadequate bathroom infrastructure in residential buildings for preventing virus transmission between occupants during quarantine."},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to increased transmission of viruses"},{"name":"Inadequate distancing measures leading to higher risk of virus transmission"},{"name":"Lack of hygiene facilities leading to poor sanitation and disease spread"},{"name":"Viral transmission in buildings and transportation"},{"name":"Environmental contamination in hospitals"},{"name":"Changes in building activities and layouts due to covid-19"},{"name":"Virus transmission in crowded and poorly ventilated rooms"},{"name":"Inadequate building design for preventing virus spread"},{"name":"Negative impact on economic progress"},{"name":"Development and sharing of data models for infectious diseases"},{"name":"Lack of machine-readable epidemiological quantitative data"},{"name":"Inadequate sharing of epidemiological quantitative data"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of epidemiological terms in obo bio-ontologies may hinder interoperability and consistency in data representation."},{"name":"Logical inconsistency due to the link between bfo and gfo in the obo landscape may lead to incompatible temporal regions."},{"name":"Use of the entity-quality eq model or the adaptation of the resources, events, agents rea model for ontology evaluation may introduce semantic and logical complexities."},{"name":"The rise of new variants of the virus that may challenge vaccine efficacy"},{"name":"Lack of compatible logical model for representing and sharing machine-readable patient monitoring and epidemiology surveillance data"},{"name":"Unclear taxonomy structure for infectious diseases ontology"},{"name":"Reuse of ontological terms and models from existing sources"},{"name":"Use of owl 2, a dl-based formalism and semantic web standard for knowledge representation"},{"name":"Building a fair resource for health data and research"},{"name":"Excluded areas may have different socioeconomic variables, potentially biasing the results."},{"name":"Lack of individual-level socioeconomic data limited detailed study of mechanisms at work."},{"name":"Decrease in testing rate in the most deprived areas signals a deterioration in access to preventive measures."},{"name":"Differential impact of lockdown on sars-cov-2 outcomes in deprived and less deprived areas"},{"name":"Variation in sars-cov-2 outcomes according to population density"},{"name":"Association between social inequalities and differential exposure to the virus, susceptibility to infection, comorbidities, and access to care."},{"name":"Differential sars-cov-2 incidence, positivity rates, and testing rates in socially deprived areas compared to the least deprived areas."},{"name":"Social gradient in sars-cov-2 incidence and testing likelihood, more pronounced in densely populated socially deprived areas."},{"name":"Loss of confidence in collective forms of transport"},{"name":"Low return rate of people who completely gave up public transport"},{"name":"Congestion in public transport during rush hours"},{"name":"Unpredictable factors disrupting sustainable mobility culture"},{"name":"Decreased use of public transport due to fear of contagion"},{"name":"Shift to private vehicles and shared mobility services"},{"name":"Correlation between feeling of safety and feeling of comfort with willingness to use public transport after the epidemic"},{"name":"Fear of passengers not following hygienic regimes"},{"name":"Overcrowding in public transport due to miscalculation"},{"name":"Limited or resigned use of public transport"},{"name":"Fear of infection with covid-19 leading to a shift from public transport to private vehicles."},{"name":"Feeling less safe using public transport, affecting attitudes and habits towards public transport use."},{"name":"Factors affecting comfort and safety in public transport during the pandemic, including fear of other passengers not following hygienic measures and tidiness of the vehicle."},{"name":"Decrease in public transport usage due to covid-19 fear and restrictions"},{"name":"Switch from stationary work and learning to e-learning and online work"},{"name":"Fear of coronavirus infection leading to limited mobility and social lives"},{"name":"Passengers declare a majority of factors as important for their comfort in public transport, indicating a potential risk of transmission of contagious diseases from other passengers."},{"name":"Passengers identify other passengers as a key factor in feeling safe in public transport, suggesting a risk of contagious disease transmission from other passengers."},{"name":"Existence of cctv systems is deemed least important for feeling safe in public transport, potentially indicating a risk of inadequate surveillance for safety and hygiene practices."}]}
